events.message: The insured reported an auto accident involving a rear-end collision on a busy highway during rush hour, causing damage to the rear bumper and tail lights.
The claim was classified under Auto Accident after verifying keywords related to vehicle damage and collision from the initial report.
An agent specialized in vehicular collision claims was assigned to manage this case and provide guidance to the insured.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that investigation will begin promptly.
Requested submission of police report, photos of vehicle damage, and witness statements to proceed with the claim investigation.
The insured submitted the required documents including photographs, police report, and a written statement describing the collision circumstances.
The investigation team began examining the submitted evidence to determine liability and verify claim validity.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault; damage assessment was performed with estimated repair costs provided.
A settlement proposal was sent to the insured outlining coverage amounts and repair cost reimbursement.
The customer responded positively to the settlement offer, expressing satisfaction with the prompt and fair handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims department after all documentation and investigation results were verified.
Payment for vehicle repair costs was processed and disbursed to the insured's designated repair shop bank account.
The claim file was closed after successful payment and confirmation of repairs completion by the insured.
All records and correspondence related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance purposes.
